name: The Resource Information Program for Parents on Lifestyle and Education (RIPPLE): A Parent-based eHealth Tool to Prevent Childhood Obesity

creator.name: Martz, Patricia
creator.affiliation: Ministry of Health, Government of Alberta

author.name: Martz, Patricia
author.affiliation: Ministry of Health, Government of Alberta

description: The objective of this study was to determine the feasibility and preliminary impact of an eHealth screening, brief intervention and referral to treatment (SBIRT) tool delivered in primary care to help parents prevent childhood obesity. The SBIRT was entitled RIPPLE - the Resource Information Program for Parents on Lifestyle and Education. Parents of children were recruited from a primary care clinic and invited to participate in the SBIRT on a study-designated tablet. The SBIRT was brief (~15 minutes) and parents completed it while they awaited their child's upcoming pediatrician appointment. The SBIRT (i) screened for children's weight status using children's measured height and weight, (ii) randomly assigned parents to one-of-four brief interventions (two on nutrition, two on physical activity) or an eHealth control group, and (iii) provided parents with a menu of resources (i.e., online handouts, information on community services) to help prevent obesity in children.

citation.text: Avis JL, Cave AL, Donaldson S, Ellendt C, Holt NL, Jelinski S, Martz P, Maximova K, Padwal R, Wild TC, Ball GD. Working With Parents to Prevent Childhood Obesity: Protocol for a Primary Care-Based eHealth Study. JMIR Research Protocols 2015;4(1):e35.
